items.headline: Ozempic cuts heart-attack risk by nearly 25% in older patients, new study finds
items.summary_en: The wildly popular Ozempic drug cuts heart attack, stroke and death risk by nearly 25% in older patients, according to a new study published by Novo Nordisk and released on Thursday.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: I’m leaving the bulk of my estate to my youngest son as he is my only child with grandchildren. Do I need a will?
items.summary_en: “I have Vanguard stocks valued at about $350,000 and two savings accounts, each of which has $100,000.”

items.headline: $3.8 million mansion where Sydney Sweeney and Amanda Seyfried filmed ‘The Housemaid’ puts N.J. town on the map
items.summary_en: Sydney Sweeney and Amanda Seyfried turned a small New Jersey town into a Hollywood hot spot while filming “The Housemaid,” which was primarily shot in a mansion there.

items.headline: What the market got wrong in reacting to Powell’s press conference, according to Goldman economist
items.summary_en: The fact that Fed Chair Jerome Powell classified the rate cut made on Wednesday as one for “risk management” is a clue the central bank will cut again in October, an economist at Goldman Sachs says.

items.headline: ‘Am I the biggest loser with the Fed rate cut?’ I’m 68, retired and live off IRAs and Social Security
items.summary_en: The Federal Reserve cut policy rates by 25 basis points, to a range of 4% to 4.25%, and pencils in two more reductions this year.

items.headline: Social Security could change eligibility rules for disability — blocking benefits for 750,000 disabled Americans
items.summary_en: “Further tightening of an already strict program would likely worsen outcomes,” new report says.

items.headline: Hot IPO market continues, as cybersecurity-software company Netskope raises $908 million
items.summary_en: The IPO market is at its hottest point in years, and cybersecurity-software company Netskope Inc. became the latest to take the leap late Wednesday, pricing its initial public offering at $19 a share, raising about $908.2 million and valuing the company at about $7.3 billion.

items.headline: This $1.6 billion deal is a sign that the worst of the crisis in office real estate is in the past
items.summary_en: The market for office space has struggled to bounce back from the pandemic — but there are encouraging signals in marquee markets.

items.headline: ABC pulls Jimmy Kimmel  following government pushback over Charlie Kirk comments
items.summary_en: ABC said Wednesday that it was pulling late-night host Jimmy Kimmel’s show indefinitely following remarks he made about the shooting of conservative activist Charlie Kirk that had drawn a rebuke from the Trump administration.
